DOC.brief_summary: This is a Natural History study to characterize key aspects of the clinical course of late onset Lysosomal Acid Lipase (LAL) Deficiency/ Cholesteryl Ester Storage Disease (CESD).
DOC.brief_title: An Observational Study of Patients With Lysosomal Acid Lipase Deficiency/Cholesteryl Ester Storage Disease Phenotype
DOC.detailed_description: The objective of this study is to characterize key aspects of the clinical presentation, disease phenotype and progression of patients with late onset Lysosomal Acid Lipase (LAL) Deficiency/ Cholesteryl Ester Storage Disease (CESD) including, but not limited to, age of presentation, onset of hepatomegaly, progression over time of liver function, and stability of lipid abnormalities.
DOC.criteria: Patients with late onset LAL Deficiency/ Cholesteryl Ester Storage Disease (CESD) who are 5 years of age or older and have required data points in their medical record Required data points for inclusion are not available
DOC.keyword: Late Onset Lysosomal Acid Lipase (LAL) Deficiency
Acid cholesteryl ester hydrolase deficiency, type 2
